description.narrative: The development objective of the project is to support efficient, accountable and responsive delivery of public services through the modernization of Myanmar’s PFM systems and strengthening institutional capacity.

participating-org.narrative: Office of the Auditor General of the Union

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Annual Work Plans and Budgets | Description :The Recipient shall prepare and submit to the Association for itsapproval not later than two months before the beginning of each Fiscal Year an Annual Work Plan and Budget containing all eligibleproject activities and expenditures. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Mid-term Progress Report | Description :The Recipient shall: (a) on or about the date twenty four (24) monthsafter the Effective Date, prepare and furnish to the Association a mid-term report, in such detail as the Association shallreasonably request, documenting progress achieved in the carrying outof the Project during the period preceding the date of suchreport. | Due April 15, 2017

Finance Agreement :Project Operations Manual | Description :The Recipient shall ensure that the Project is carried out inaccordance with the arrangements and procedures set out in the Project Operations Manual. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Project Reports and Interim Unaudited Financial Reports | Description :The Recipient shall submit to theAssociation project progress reports and interim unaudited financial reports within 45 days of each calendar semester. | Frequency:Semi Annual

Finance Agreement :Project institutional arrangements | Description :The Recipient shall maintain at all times during theimplementation of the Project: the PFM Executive Reform team, focal points in each project line department, the PFM ReformSecretariat, and the Project Support Services Units in MOF and OAG, all with functions, composition, staffing and resourcessatisfactory to the Association. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

title.narrative: Number of beneficiaries of training courses
Timeliness of reconciled budget execution reports

actual.value: Treasury Department could submit Monthly Union Fund Account to MOPFI, Cabinet, OAG within two months of following the accountingmonth.

title.narrative: Improving information base for linking budgets to plans- number of departments submitting recurrent and capital budget forms electronically
Number of large and medium tax-payers completing self-assessment
Number of key budget and fiscal documents published on the MoPF website for public access

target.value: The end of project target for number of key fiscal documents publicly available has been increased to 9, including a budgetdashboard and a report on gender informed budgeting for 1 service sector.

actual.value: The public can access the following 7 documents at https://www.mopfi.gov.mm 1. 2019/20FY Annual budget law 2. Budget summary(pre-budget statement) 3. Budget Speech 4. Citizens Budgets 5. Annual budget report 6. Mid-year budget report 7. Quarterly budgetreport 8. 2019/20FY Budget Estimate GFS 9. 2019/20FY Fiscal Policy. The budget dashboard is not operational. Report ongender-informed budgeting is on progress.

title.narrative: Composition of expenditure out-turn compared to original approved.
New Financial Rules and Regulations are enaced and published

baseline.value: Financial rules and regulations outdated and not widely available.

target.value: Updated financial rules and regulations published and adopted.

actual.value: New Financial Rules and Regulations enacted on 1st April, 2017 and posted on the website (https://www.mopf.gov.mm). OfficialEnglish version of the financial rules and regulations (FRR) approved and posted on MOPF website in October 2018.

title.narrative: Budget preparation process including (i) issuance of ceilings (ii) preparation of medium-term fiscal framework
Timeliness of Submission of Audit Report to Parliament

baseline.value: IPSAS standards are not applied in Myanmar accounting and financial reporting

target.value: MOPF and OAG have adopted a transition plan for the adoption of IPSAS over the medium term

actual.value: The IPSAS transition plan was jointly adopted by OAG and MOPF as of 30 November 2019

title.narrative: Delivery of a core banking system (CBS)

baseline.value: No such modern system existed. MEB treasury processes remain largely paper based.

target.value: The CBS is expected to be acquired and tested in Head office and a large branch in Yangon

actual.value: Successful rebidding for procuring the Core Banking System undertaken through limited international rebidding. The contractnegotiation is in process with expected signature of the contract in October 2020.

title.narrative: Modernization of tax administration information system

baseline.value: There is no integrated tax information and administration system at IRD.

target.value: Delivery of an integrated tax information system for testing in IRD headquarters, LTO and MTO.

actual.value: ITAS Bid Evaluation Report is ready to submit internal approval and WB's authorzation.

title.narrative: Increase in Tax collection from Large Taxpayers

baseline.value: Baseline: Taxes collected by LTO in FY 2015-2016 was 1,105,670 million MMK.

target.value: Taxes collected by LTO for FY 2020/21 is estimated at 3,250,000 million MMK

actual.value: Taxes collected by LTO from large taxpayers in FY 2019/20 (as of 8th Sept 2020) stood at 3,665,156 million MMK.

title.narrative: Improved budget credibility and budget out-turn in key public service sectors (health, education and transport)
Information on procurement opportunities and contract awards (above USD 100 000) are publicly available for 5 Union ministries.
Establishement of the PFM training academy to enhance sustainability of PFM training

baseline.value: PFM academy is not yet operational

target.value: PFM academy is established and carrying out initial training. A gender dis-aggregated training monitoring and evaluation frameworkis operational.

actual.value: PFM academy is established in February 2020 and carrying out initial trainings. A gender dis-aggregated training monitoring andevaluation framework is operational.

title.narrative: Capacity building of JPAC to Strengthen Parliamentary oversight

baseline.value: JPAC received initial capacity building notably on English and ICT skills as well as IT modernization. There is a need tostrengthen JPAC's involvement in the drafting of the new PFM bill.

target.value: Publication of the draft PFM bill with inputs from JPAC

actual.value: Initial capacity building an technical assistance has been delivered, but not on critical reforms such as the PFM bill.

baseline.value: The financial reporting is largely manual, cumbersome and prone to errors and delays.

target.value: The automated treasury system FIRST has been developed and implemented in (20) Government Agencies as a pilot project by the end ofthe project.

actual.value: Current Treasury management and reporting is largely manual. An automated information system is being developed. MOPFI is pilotingthe Financial Information and Reporting System for Treasury (FIRST) in 20 Government agencies in June 2020.
